intro: Helianthus asper, commonly known as rough sunflower, is a species of flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces large, showy yellow flowers with a central disk of dark褐色 seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy perennial in many regions. Helianthus asper is often found in prairies, open woods, and along roadsides, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
